description: President Joe Biden is out of the race, but his campaign still has nearly $96 million left in the bank.
title: Who Gets the $96 Million Sitting in Biden’s Campaign Account?

description: Welcome to a special Washington Edition.  Readers of the Balance of Power newsletter are also receiving this special edition. Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green assesses what’s next for Democrats, and for Donald Trump  To get Washington Edition going forward, sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Harris Has Her Moment and Trump Has Attacks at the Ready

description: World leaders paid tribute to Joe Biden after the US president announced that he won’t be standing for reelection in November. He is the first sitting president since 1968 to drop out of a presidential race.
title: World Leaders Praise Biden’s Record After President Quits Race

description: Notable Democrats including Bill and Hillary Clinton and former Labor Secretary Robert Reich were quick to endorse Kamala Harris as the party’s presidential candidate after Joe Biden dropped out of the race. Other high-profile figures, including some potential rivals to Harris, focused their statements on praise for Biden without commenting on who his replacement should be.
title: Democrats Praise Biden’s Exit, Though Some Are Silent on Harris

description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer doesn’t intend to challenge Vice President Kamala Harris and run for the the Democratic presidential nomination, said a person with knowledge of the matter.
title: Michigan’s Whitmer Said to Stand Down From Presidential Run

description: US Vice President Kamala Harris announced that she would seek the Democratic presidential nomination following Joe Biden’s exit from the 2024 race, while endorsing his former running mate to take his place.
title: Kamala Harris Says She Is Running for President

description: Investors are set to start the week scrambling to decide if President Joe Biden’s decision to end his reelection campaign and endorse Vice President Kamala Harris increases or decreases Donald Trump’s chances of regaining power.
title: Biden Exit Leaves Markets Asking What’s Next for ‘Trump Trade’

description: President Joe Biden announced Sunday he’s no longer seeking the Democratic Party’s nomination, saying his exit from the race was in the best interests of his party and the country. The 81-year-old incumbent pulled out of the race after a poor debate performance raised doubts about his ability to defeat the Republican nominee, 78-year-old former President Donald Trump. Biden threw his support to his running mate, Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Biden Quits Race, Leaving Democrats in Limbo. What Happens Now?

description: US President Joe Biden is exiting the 2024 election race and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris to become the Democratic nominee and take on Donald Trump.
title: Read Joe Biden’s Statement on Quitting the Race, Endorsing Kamala Harris

description: US President Joe Biden said he will not seek reelection, a historic reversal that came after weeks of pressure from Democrats for the 81-year-old to exit the race in hopes of improving their chances of preventing Donald Trump from returning to the White House.
title: Biden Drops Out of 2024 Election, Endorses Kamala Harris

description: President Joe Biden announced in a letter posted on X, that he will be dropping out of the 2024 presidential race. Photographer: Photographer: Erin Schaff/The New York Times/Bloomberg
title: Joe Biden Drops Out of Presidential Race

description: The US Secret Service’s embattled leader is about to field a barrage of questions from hostile lawmakers who want her out of a job after the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump.
title: Secret Service Chief Faces Lawmaker Grilling Over Trump Shooting

description: Still, the Israeli faces major challenges at home and abroad.
title: A Confident Netanyahu Takes His Message to a Weakened Biden

description: Sudan’s army-led government said it exchanged ambassadors with Iran, fully restoring diplomatic ties as the military bolsters its overseas alliances while fighting a brutal civil war.
title: War-Torn Sudan Fully Restores Iran Ties With Ambassador Swap

description: President Joe Biden’s beleaguered campaign entered July with $96 million cash on hand, after a spending spree last month that depleted about 93% of the money it raised in June.
title: Biden’s Campaign Burned Through 93% of Money It Raised in June

description: Senator Joe Manchin called on President Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 presidential race, adding his voice to about three dozen US lawmakers saying it’s time to find a different candidate.
title: Manchin Calls On Biden to Drop Out, Saying There’s Other Talent

description: Bitcoin miners and crypto companies that have been stonewalled in efforts to go public in the US may ultimately be the biggest winners in the digital-asset world under a second Donald Trump presidency. Foreign companies at risk of losing market share may end up being the biggest losers.
title: ‘Almost’ Everyone in Crypto’s a Winner in a Second Trump Administration

description: Humanitarian groups are considering a mass vaccination campaign for Palestinians in the Gaza Strip after traces of variant poliovirus type 2 were found in water sources in the war-torn territory.
title: Poliovirus Traces Detected in Gaza, Raising Fears of Outbreak

description: An electricity-transmission line between Turkey and Iraq that’s been planned for 20 years began operating, potentially helping the oil-producing Arab nation tackle grueling power outages.
title: Blackout-Hit Iraq Begins Importing Turkish Power With New Line

description: China’s ruling Communist Party called for changes to the military’s weapon procurement system as it urged deeper reforms, and after the ousting two former defense ministers on corruption charges.
title: China Wants Better Arms Procurement System to Meet Security Aims

description: China published the full text on Sunday of the decision on further deepening reform and advancing Chinese modernization, the policies discussed at a plenum held last week by the central committee of the Chinese Communist Party.
title: Highlights of China CPC Third Plenum’s Resolution on Reforms

description: The Philippines said it clinched a “provisional arrangement” with China on its resupply missions to a military outpost in the South China Sea as part of efforts to ease tensions.
title: Philippines, China Reach Understanding on Disputed Sea Missions

description: France’s Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said the minimum wage could be increased, opening the door to a key proposal of the leftist bloc that’s vying for influence over policy in the next government.
title: Macron Minister Warms to the French Left’s Minimum Wage Plan

description: China will improve its supervision mechanism for the $66 trillion financial sector and regulate all sorts of financial activities, according to the ruling Communist Party’s long-term plan for the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China to Improve Supervision Mechanism for Finance Industry

description: Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said he’ll meet US President Joe Biden in Washington on Tuesday, a day before the Israeli prime minister is due to address a joint session of Congress.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu Will Meet With Recovering Biden on Tuesday

description: Ukraine’s troops withdrew from the village of Prohres in the Donetsk region as they faced a risk of being trapped by Russian forces, the DeepState map service said on Telegram.
title: Ukraine’s Troops Abandon Donetsk Village Amid Encirclement Risk

description: President Xi Jinping vowed to increase support for indebted local governments and reform China’s taxation system, as the ruling Communist Party unveiled its long-term plan for the world’s second-largest economy.
title: Xi Vows Tax Reform, to Improve Budget in New Economic Blueprint

description: The UK faces a large fiscal hole if its new Labour government agrees to above-inflation pay rises for millions of public-sector workers like teachers and nurses.
title: UK Faces Fiscal Hole if Labour Grants Above-Inflation Pay Awards

description: Bangladesh’s top court abolished most of a controversial government jobs quota system after deadly protests by students in the country’s capital in the past week.
title: Bangladesh Top Court Scraps Most Job Quotas After Deadly Clashes

description: Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest man, is calling off plans to invest in a new steel plant in Nigeria after the government accused him of seeking to become a monopoly with his new refinery in the West African nation.
title: Dangote to Scrap Steel Investment Over Allegations of Monopoly

description: Mexico’s president-elect Claudia Sheinbaum blasted Donald Trump for his “rude” language after he gave a speech recounting his past negotiations with incoming economy minister Marcelo Ebrard, marking a potentially tense relationship with the Republican presidential candidate.
title: Trump’s Remarks Spark Rebuke From Mexico’s President-Elect

description: Two months of silence from Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey have left anyone guessing the timing of a crucial change in interest rates with not much to go on.
title: Bailey’s Silent Treatment Stokes BOE August Rate-Cut Suspense

description: South Korean prosecutors questioned President Yoon Suk Yeol’s wife for the first time over allegations of receiving a luxury handbag as a gift and of stock manipulation, Yonhap News Agency reported.
title: S. Korea Prosecutors Question First Lady on Luxury Bag: Yonhap
